item.title: Report E-2023090622
item.description:
Report E-2023090622

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN1760 GF PHOS 417 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 150-gallons of material released to two areas of the concrete dock floor each measuring 20’ x 20’. The release was caused due to a forklift puncture. The remaining material in the tote was transferred into a new tote. Water was deployed to neutralize the impacted areas and absorbents were then used to collect all material. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (9) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090619
item.description:
Report E-2023090619

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN1903 MBC 516 release from a 275-gallon poly. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of material released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to the lid of the tote being crushed in as a result of improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The old tote was cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. Soda ash was then deployed along with absorbents to clean the impacted area. All impacted waste was placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090588
item.description:
Report E-2023090588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of UN2922 was crushed during transit and released its full contents to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized absorbent pads, a sprayer, and a neutralizing solution to wipe down all freight and the impacted floor of the trailer and dock until the surfaces tested neutral and were sufficiently remediated. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All three (3) containers of waste were labeled appropriately and staged on-site.

item.title: Report E-2023090585
item.description:
Report E-2023090585

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CARTERSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NRG experienced a UN3266 AFCO 8714 Rave Hydroxy 50% release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of material released to an 8’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor, and a 6' x 4' area of the concrete yard below due to a damaged seal around the port. Citric acid and water solution were utilized to neutralize the impacted areas and then cleaned with absorbents. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 30-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023090106
item.description:
Report I-2023090106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: FORT LAUDERDALE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Passenger carrying a container of dry ice filled with medicine. Southwest was not made aware of the dry ice packaging by the passenger and passed through the security checkpoint. The dry ice was not packaged properly to release the buildup of pressure resulting in an explosion during pushback. Crew returned to the gate and was meet by LEO, EMS and city fire department. No injuries were reported, EMS evaluated passengers and crew upon deplaning. Pictures available upon request.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package leaked product on unloaders who moved the wet box. We quickly ascertained the product was ethanol to assure them they were not in danger of a corrosive substance. The package handlers washed hands and returned to work. DescribePack: The release was caused by a loose cap during transport. The continuous sloshing of liquid during transit caused contents to escape the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We immediate isolated the box in a plastic-lined tote and set-aside in the hazmat cage until we could process the DPR and ISF. We used towels to wipe up the wet surface in the trailer.

item.description:
Report E-2023090563

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 18, 2023, at 2013 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in El Paso, Texas regarding the release of approximately 2-gallons of AIRSTONE™ 786H-B WIND INFUSION HARDENER (UN2735, Amines, Liquid, Corrosive, N.O.S, 8, II) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a 1’x 53’ and a 1’ x 1’ area on the trailer floor. There was also a second tote with hardened crystallization on it, but with no leak. Contractors were able to transfer the remaining product from the damaged tote into a new tote, clean the crystallization off the second tote, and the release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • City: LAREDO

  • Description: On September 15, 2023, at 1226 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) quart of ISOPHORONEDIAMINE (UN2289, 8, III) from (1) 55-gallon DM. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a small area on the trailer floor and the concrete underneath the trailer due to the release seeping through the trailer floor. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 65-gallon overpack DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090559
item.description:
Report E-2023090559

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN1903 were damaged by a load shift and released approximately a quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon to remediate the site. Ancon personnel deployed granular absorbents to the disinfectant-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and impacted wood were collected and containerized into one (1)30-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2023090557
item.description:

  • City: NORWALK

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2735 was punctured while in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES deconstructed the pallet and removed one (1) 55-gallon drum from the pallet. The crew placed damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and the released material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. ES staged the material onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

  • Description: On September 11, 2023, one (!) one-gallon jug of UN2924 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 3/4-gallon of product to the box, pallet, and floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The undamaged cargo was staged in a new area for continued processing and shipping. Granular absorbents were deployed to the impacted area and worked in with hand tools. All UN2924-impacted material was collected and containerized into the one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was properly labeled and possession of the material was taken by RLC for disposal through their bulk waste stream.

  • Description: On September 1, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3287 was crushed during transit and released approximately less-than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. item.description:

  • City: KERNERSVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NWN experienced a UN3266 Gengard GN8209 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of material released to a 6’ x 20’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a cubic yard box. All impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: PORT ALLEN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the QC process in the warehouse at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility, the drum was removed from the pallet to be weighed. The drum was weighed and set aside for approximately 30 minutes. When the employee returned back to the drum, he noticed a very small pinhole leak coming from the side, rib area of the drum. The leak was minor and the drum was promptly overpacked and the spill was cleaned up.

item.title: Report E-2023090528
item.description:
Report E-2023090528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: DURANT
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSH experienced a customer location release of UN1791 Sodium Hypochlorite 12.5% from a 55-gallon poly drum. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of material released the drum lid only. The vented bung on the drum released due to the drum being tipped over off of the pallet. The drum was re-secured to the pallet for shipment on and wiped down. All impacted absorbent pads were collected and containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Sherman, TX and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1789 Hydrochloric Acid 31% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contactors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-ounce of material released to the top of the tote in a 1’ x 1’ area due to a loose/damaged cap. The cap was replaced with a new one and the tote was wiped down with a sodium bicarb solution. The damaged cap, impacted rags, and PPE were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: SEAFORD
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSA experienced a UN1760 Clothesline Fresh BLD 2 release from (6) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived confirmed approximately 20-gallons of material released to an 8’ x 15’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 4’ area of the concrete lot below due to improper loading; the pallet tipped over in transit. The impacted areas were cleaned with absorbents and neutralized with 30% vinegar solution. All impacted absorbents and the damaged pails were collected and containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • City: HARLINGEN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHG experienced a UN1791 Hasachlor release from a 15-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete spill cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of material released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to faulty seals on the drums. The crew replaced all seals on the drums and secured them for shipment on. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbent which were collected along with the impacted pallet wood and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090459
item.description:
Report E-2023090459

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced a UN1263 Carbocoat 8239 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of material released to an 8’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents utilized to clean the impacted area were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090445
item.description:
Report E-2023090445

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 8, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint (UN1263) were damaged by a skid and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents, absorbent pads and cleaners to the paint primer-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, impacted pallets and absorbent pads were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Damaged pails were patched up and over-packed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report E-2023090388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN1993 Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and secure the tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-ounces of material released to the tote lid due to a loose cap. The released product was wiped up using simple green and absorbent rags. The cap was re-secured, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would no longer be a release in transit. The waste rags were then containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090386

  • City: BLYTHE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a NA1993 EC5627A release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and securement of the tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of material released to the tote body down all four sides and a 4” x 4” area of the dock floor due to a loose gasket. The released product was wiped up using simple green and absorbent rags. The gasket was re-secured, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would no longer be a release in transit. The waste rags were then containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023090101
item.description:
Report I-2023090101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: Santa Clara
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Around 6:30am, the yard personnel were in the process of transferring containers to different trailers when they noticed a tote that might have a possible leak around the valve. They prepped an empty tote in the event there was a need to transfer the material out of the tote. Once they were all prepped, they checked the valve handle to make sure it was fully in the closed position. When the outlet cap was unscrewed, the material shot out of the valve due to a missing ball valve. Over half of the material was captured in the second tote and approximately 125 gals of the material released to the asphalt around the load dock. There was no release to the environment. The yard team quickly controlled the release with berms, absorbents, and vermiculite/floor dry and proceeded to clean up the material.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG, FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS COROSIVE. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE AND USED THE NEUTRALIZER TO ABSORB THE SUBSTANCE. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE PLASTIC PAIL HAS A TINY HOLE IN IT. LOOKS LIKE IT WAS SCRATCHED ON THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL PRIOR TO BEING PACKED IN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER.

DescribePack: lid on one of the six bottles of nitric acid failed which caused the leakage and damage.. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area was cleared, the cat litter was used as a neutralizer.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Event occurred onboard UA2274 ORD-EWR on 28AUG2023 1. FA Patrik Repka(u399744) noticed an unusual smell after the inflight service 2. He quickly realized the smell was coming from his personal disposable vape in his pocket 3. The vape was hot to the touch though no flames were present 4. FA believes there may have been light"vape" smoke as the device appeared to have been running 5. FAs notified the flight deck and obtained the TCB 6. FAs placed overheating vape inside the TCB and stowed TCB in aft galley cart 7. After customers deplaned in EWR, FAs handed off TCB with vape inside to the CSR 8. FA Repka stated the device was a Lava brand disposable vape

item.title: Report I-2023090095
item.description:
Report I-2023090095

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: Baltimore
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Minibulk Driver was unloading hydrochloric acid into a tank when the driver noticed the product was leaking out of a 55-gallon drum that was being used as an overflow tank. A valve on the customers tank was left open and the product was flowing into the overflow drum which had a crack in the bottom of it. The driver then shut off his valves from the truck to stop the unloading process to allow customer to close the valve. The product was flowing out of the cracked drum onto a concrete pad for 5 minutes. The customer took responsibility for the release and replaced the cracked drum to ensure there would not be a release in the future if the overflow tank would be utilized. The product was used in the cleaning process of the concrete pad where it was spilled.

item.title: Report E-2023090533
item.description:
Report E-2023090533

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: SIOUX FALLS
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRANSWOOD CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 9, 2023, TransWood Carriers contacted ERTS to request assistance with the clean-up of a 400-gallon release of Biodiesel at a Flying J truck stop. It was reported that a storm drain, and public street were impacted by the release. Before the contractor was dispatched the Fire Department was on site and he advised the storm drain was impacted but it did not reach the outfall. The Fire Department placed tons of sand on the impacted areas. HMRI arrived on site advised that three drains were impacted but the last drain the product settled in the basin. A vac truck was used to recover all free-standing product and absorbents and boom were placed to collect any remaining product. An estimated 640 gallons of oily water was recovered and transferred to 330-gallon totes. HMRI completed the cleanup generating one roll of containing impacted absorbents and two 330-gallon poly totes of impacted water. The roll off remained on site and the totes were staged at the contractor's shop until profiled and proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023090063
item.description:
Report X-2023090063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-27
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG EMPLOYEE EVACUATED THE TRAILER AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was picked up on 8/21 in our area. It was found the next morning as having been damaged. Somehow, it was damaged between the pickup time on Monday and Tuesday morning when it was noted as damaged. The package had a corrosive label and the SDS revealed it to be a Haz Mat. However, the shipper didn't ship it as a Haz Mat - no Certification or OP900. It was brought to QA and then the Haz Cage once it was discovered. DescribePack: The cap came off 1 bottle spilling the entire contents on the interior of the box. None of the other bottles are salvageable. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was brought to QA and then held for the Haz Mat specialist.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow due to the external carton wet. Package came off the trailer # 823918 from the unload, already damaged wet and leaking. The package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking damaged package. The tote was then taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there was 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Ethanol 140 Proof. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .40 gallons to release. Corrugated liner was used on the top of bottles for packing. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Ethanol 140 Proof had a loose cap allowing .40 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking damaged package, then was taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection

  • Description: SequenceEvent: We have received a tip from a driver that a hazmat package is leaking and there BC which is for H@S logistics told the driver to drop off the package at the VSA table without any notice to the station. The driver said that there is a leak in her van where some of the solution leaked out. It was in the bottom corner of the p1000 van which is on Van # 448260 on WA0127. We went ahead and cleaned the spill using Amphomag universal spill neutralizer and Vinyl gloves. The bottle of concentrated detergent does have liquid in the bag, and it seems to be spilling at a seem just below the cap or on it. Contents only contained 1 single bottle of detergent. DescribePack: Seems to be a break in the seem just below or on the cap. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Nothing was done until package arrived at station/spill not known. Open knowledge, package was placed in a container and spill was neutralized at spill location.

Due to the extent of damage to the trailer, the gasoline needed to be transferred into another trailer. During the course of the transfer, approximately 1 gallon of gasoline was released. First Call Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.description:
Report X-2023081662

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLERS WERE PULLING THE ICS OFF THE BELT, THEY PICKED UP THIS PACKAGE AND SET IT ON THE ROLLERS AND THEY STARTED FEELING A TINGLEY SINSATION IN THIER HANDS. THEY IMMEDIATELY INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION AND ALSO INFORMED THEM THEY DID NOT KNOW WHICH PACKAGE IT CAME FROM. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH A TOTE LINED WITH HAZBAG AND NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB. UPON ARRIVAL, QA NOTICED THE 5 GALLON BUCKET ON THE ROLLERS AND NOTICED IT WAS LEAKING OUT THRU THE AIR HOLE IN THE CAP. THEY PLACED IT IN THE TOTE AND INFORMED THE MANAGER WHICH PACKAGE IT CAME FROM. QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FELL OVER ON THE BELT AND THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT THRU THE MIDDLE OF THE CAP (AIR HOLE). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACAKGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZBAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: hazmat was discovered this morning on the inbound as needing a relabel because the original label was destroyed. someone set it aside and placed a 33 (address search) on the package. this evening the HAP specialist noticed that the package was not in UNPOP packaging and had been repacked by someone at Fedex Ground. He brought it over to the damage area for HESS specialist to inspect later. Around 7:15pm, HESS specialist had the time to inspect and found that the bottles inside had been placed inside a blue hazmat bag and ziptied shut. HESS specialist noticed liquid inside with the bottles and placed it in a lined tote, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: three bottles leaked due to loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Description: ABF picked up a tote at a customer location and traveled to the next pick-up. When ABF arrived at the next customer location and began ~backing onto the property, the customer advised the ABF driver that the trailer was leaking. Upon opening the trailer, it was discovered ~that the tote that ABF had picked up at the previous stop was leaking. The ABF driver was unsure of the cause of the leak but advised ~that he put straps on the tote to secure it and that the strap may have damaged the tote somehow. The customer had a team of their ~workers clean the trailer and their dock. ABF contacted CUR A to send a cleaning crew for the customers yard and the side of the street ~leading to it.

item.title: Report X-2023081708
item.description:
Report X-2023081708

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Aug 21st during the sort a package was found leaking on the belt. The package was not marked or labeled as dangerous goods on the outside of the package. Further investigation after opening the package found that there were twelve cans of a two part resin, six cans of part A and six cans of part B. The leaking receptacle PTM&W PT2475A was non-DG according to the safety data sheet, approximately 50ml of the product spilled out. The other six cans contained PTM&W PT2475B, which according to the safety data sheet are UN1760, Corrosive liquid n.o.s., 8, III. The package was contained in a salvage drum, and is being held at the station pending further disposition due to the undeclared element.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the preload sort, it was raining and the bottom of the package had gotten damp. One of the bottles broke when it hit the floor. A manager placed absorb powder and pads on it to clean it up and placed the contents into a yellow hazmat drum. DescribePack: The bottom of the box became damp due to the rain and the glue became loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a yellow hazmat drum, sealed, and placed into the hazmat cage under ventilation.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT DAMAGE TOTE AND LEFT AT HAZMAT CAGE FOR INSPECTION

  • Description: On July 31st during the PM sort a package was found to be leaking. The package did not show any signs on the outside that it was a regulated dangerous good. There were no marks, labels, or documentation. Upon further investigation the package was opened and it contained Mrs. Meyers Clean Day Room Freshener, Lilac Scent, one of which had leaked An SDS was located and it shows that it is regulated as UN1170 Ethanol Solution(Ethyl Alcohol), 3, PGIII. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is being held at the station pending disposition.

  • Description: Package was brought to the attention of the spill cleanup specialist at our Newark, NJ Ramp location. Package was seen to have wet corners which indicated leakage from inside the package. Package contained UN 1593 DICHLOROMETHANE and consisted of 1 glass bottle packed for 4L in a fiberboard box. Dunnage was not immediately reported with package, however, packing peanuts may have dissolved when product leaked. It was reported upon inspection that the bottle inside of the box had shattered. It was not reported how damage occurred to the inner container. Package was instructed to be contained in a steel salvage package and package to be destroyed as contents were a total loss.

  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/23/2023, at 0924, CSXT personnel in the Avon Yard discovered ICCX74001, a residue Covered Hopper car last contained NA3077, Hazardous Waste Solid, N.O.S. Spent Catalyst, Class 9 PGIII, leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and shipper, Shell Canada, LTD, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2023-07-23-00012). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a slow leak from the bottom outlet flange at the bottom of the chute. The issue was identified as loose flange bolts and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper representative, Jeffery Bowes, 403-465-0547, jeffrey.bowes@shell.com with Shell Emergency Management. Contractor personnel secured the outlet flange by tightening the flange bolts tool tight and decontaminating the impacted area. The leak was secured and the car was released back into transportation. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 not required.

item.title: Report I-2023060179
item.description:
Report I-2023060179

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T00:32:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: Houston
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EXXON MOBILE PIPELINE COM
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The carrier, Roberson Trucking Co., Inc.(672 Three Creeks Rd., Junction City, AR, 71749, USDOT#535803) was unaware that the salt water load they had picked up had elevated levels of hydrogen sulfide. Upon receiving the truck believed to be ordinary brine water, an EMTEC employee decided to check the headspace for H^S as a precaution. Upon doing so, 15,000 ppm of H^S were detected. EMTEC personnel devised a plan to safely offload the material. Since the Friendswood Test Facility(FTF) lab is already equipped with large Material Absorption Devices(MAD Units) for catalytically destroying H2S, hoses were Connected from the FTF frac tank to the MAD Units to purge the gas in the headspace after the material transfer from the tanker. The pumps were run until the tanker was offloaded. The frac tank venting to the MAD Units was continued for 48 hours until testing showed the H^S concentrations at 0 ppm, at which time the brine water was deemed safe. Area monitoring was also conducted to ensure safe conditions in the surrounding area. The driver was notified immediately and the driver contacted his management immediately by phone that the load was sour.

item.title: Report I-2023090081
item.description:
Report I-2023090081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-23T00:30:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-18
  • City: Steubenville
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FIRST CLASS TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 9:40am, approximately 23 miles after having the trailer loaded at Langeloth, the fifth wheel failed and he trailer came seperated from the tractor. The driver was able to stay in front of the trailer and safely guide it to a stop in the left lane of US22 west of Steubenville, OH. The trailer was nose down on the ground but did not cause any leaks. Ohio State Highway Patrol was immediately called to the scene, and National Response Center was called to report a potential release. We were able to dispatch a nearby truck to the scene to transload the product onto another tank trailer as a tow truck lifted the front of the tank to level the product and get all the product off. We received a call from the driver at 12:21 pm to report that the roadway was being reopened.

item.title: Report I-2023090085
item.description:
Report I-2023090085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-23T00:30:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-10
  • City: Houston
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was off-loading product at the cosignee. Driver thought he was empty and failed to properly depressurize his trailer and hose and close his internal valve. He then releases one cam lock lose, causing a spray of ethlyne glycol to spray out one side of the hose that last just about 10 seconds resulting in roughly a 100 gallon spill. Estimated 20 to 30 gallons of the release made it into a storm water drain. An environmental clean up company was called to respond to the scene for clean up. Once they were on the scene and made assessments, it was discovered that the storm water drain had dirt in it that actually absorbed the ethlyne glycol, not allowing it to flow into the water system. They were able to use a vaccum truck and clean beyond where the product had reached and got all the product and dirt from the drain line, roughly 6 feet into the drain line. Customer was satisfied with the clean up the environmental company provided. Customer assumed the resposibilty of disposing of the contaminated dirt cleaned out of the drain line.
